Home.MainTitle: Hello, my name is John, Nice to meet you：）
Home.MainSelfIntro: A front-end developer & designer</br>always curious about the lastest web development trends and technology.
SidePorject.ChatingWithChatGPT: Have a bad mood? Try having a talk with ChatGPT
PersonalPage.SectionOneTitle: Hi，I'm John, a front-end developer & a web designer
PersonalPage.SectionOneContent: I have 5 years of experience as a UI designer and 2 years of experience as a front-end engineer. Using Vue3 and TypeScript, I have implemented component-driven development to create reusable and maintainable common components. Moving forward, I aim to deepen my expertise in front-end development while also taking on new challenges in other areas. Thank you for your consideration.
PersonalPage.SubTitleLang: About my level of language proficiency
WorkHistory1.List01: Developed a customer service platform and integrated third-party live customer service into the platform.
WorkHistory1.List02: Maintained the code and rebuilt the functions which went out in the latest format.
WorkHistory1.List03: Built a new code style guideline and collaborated with the designer team.
WorkHistory2.List01: Designed and coded an anime service platform with 1 graphic designer and 2 back-end developers which DAU (Daily Active Users) of over 8 million.
WorkHistory2.List02: Redesigned the company’s primary service user interface for both Android and iOS with another UI designer.
WorkHistory2.List03: Designed and coded a game-selling service platform collaborated with a background engineer.
WorkHistory2.List04: Built a design guideline that combined all platforms with a graphic designer and the back-end engineer’s team.
WorkHistory2.List05: Built an auto-compile program to make the designer team become more efficient.
WorkHistory3.List01: Designed and coded a short-term event webpage using HTML, SASS, and Javascript.
WorkHistory3.List02: Responsible for designing the UI for iOS and Android apps.
ProjectAnime.Reason: The old version of the anime platform named '動畫瘋' has not been updated for a long time. Over time, the number of users increased rapidly at the end of 2020, and there was a gap in the user experience. After discussions with the UX department, it has been decided to revamp the service.
ProjectAnime.Problem01: Confusing user flow, difficulty understanding the sequence of animated video playback.
ProjectAnime.Problem02: Incomplete support for the layout between the TV and mobile versions.
ProjectAnime.Problem03: Excessive occurrence of shaking in the danmaku (overlay comments) feature.
ProjectAnime.Process01MainTitle: Before designing the pages, establish the design guidelines:
ProjectAnime.Process01ListContent01: Ensure that users are not confused by significant style differences.
ProjectAnime.Process01ListContent02: Enable users to achieve their goals within a short period of time.
ProjectAnime.Process02ListContent01: Clarify the overall service flow and page structure. Create a User Flow diagram and optimize the process with the Project Manager (PM).
ProjectAnime.Process03ListContent01: Define components for both light and dark themes and establish a UI library to expedite mockup creation.
ProjectAnime.Process04ListContent01: Change the arrangement from left-to-right so that the newest anime videos are in the top left and get progressive older as you scroll down and to the right. This way, the oldest anime video will be in the bottom right. This will enhance dynamic interactive effects and guide the user flow.
ProjectAnime.Process04ListContent02: Convert the weekly animation programs into text format to provide users with more direct information.
ProjectAnime.Process04ListContent03: Categorize and visually unify components with similar functionality.
ProjectAnime.Process04ListContent04: Reclassify pages based on functionality to simplify the complexity of the interface.
ProjectAnime.Process04ListTitle0501: PV exceeded the original expectation of 8 million to 9 million.
ProjectAnime.Process04ListTitle0502: The growth rate of paid members within six months increased from 4% to 8%.
ProjectShinChiEC.Reason: In order to explore new markets, the company has established a project for a B2B service that sells website templates. For this service development, it was decided to create a highly scalable and easy-to-maintain structure that allows clients to freely configure templates.
ProjectShinChiEC.Point01: Import UNOCSS and leverage UNOCSS's Atomic CSS engine to create code that is more readable than Tailwind CSS.
ProjectShinChiEC.Point02: Define component development rules to efficiently switch layouts.
ProjectShinChiEC.Point03: Establish guidelines through collaboration between the design team and the project management team to strike a balance between customization freedom and service stability.
ProjectShinChiEC.Process01ListTitle01: Ensure the speed of layout switching:
ProjectShinChiEC.Process01ListContent01: Establish guidelines and UI design guidelines in collaboration with the design team to ensure consistency in the number of parameters and rules for themes.
ProjectShinChiEC.Process01ListContent02: Make the UI of the web service dynamic and capable of changing over time.
ProjectShinChiEC.Process02ListContent01: Use Vue3 with TypeScript to create a structure that separates hooks and components for easier maintenance.
ProjectShinChiEC.Process02ListContent02: Manage styles using the shortcut and rule features of UNOCSS instead of creating styles with SCSS.
ProjectShinChiEC.Process04ListTitle0501: Utilizing the characteristics of Vue3 components, the estimated maintenance time has been reduced by 50%
ProjectShinChiEC.Process04ListTitle0502: By introducing UNOCSS, we have reduced the time by 25% compared to before and improved CSS maintainability and work efficiency.
ProjectBahaworld.Reason: Due to the noticeable decline in user-generated posts over the years, the company aims to build a platform similar to Facebook, where users can easily post content and increase community engagement by reducing the barriers to posting.
ProjectBahaworld.Point01: Simplify the process of user posting.
ProjectBahaworld.Point02: Strive for unified UI design between Android and iOS platforms.
ProjectBahaworld.Process03: Creating design guidelines for the product
ProjectBahaworld.Process01ListTitle01: Maintaining a consistent user experience for iOS and Android:
ProjectBahaworld.Process01ListContent01: While building the prototype, reference the Material Design Guidelines and iOS Human Interface Guidelines to ensure consistency in the user experience across both versions.
ProjectBahaworld.Process01ListContent02: Customize the types of posts on the dynamic feed according to user preferences, with the aim to replace the static homepage of the original app within one year.
ProjectBahaworld.Process02ListContent01: During the initial phase of defining functionalities, create a product architecture to facilitate discussions with the Product Manager (PM) and Research and Development (RD) team regarding product flow and support for existing data fields.
ProjectBahaworld.Process03ListContent01: Once the prototype is confirmed, simultaneously create mockups and establish design guidelines for the Bahaworld app.
ProjectBahaworld.Process03ListContent02: Next, begin breaking down the structure and categorize UI into components and elements, using Sketch to build a UI library for a systematic UI development process.
ProjectBahaworld.Process04ListTitle0501: After the release, the Daily Active Users (DAU) of the Bahaworld App grew to 70k within two months .
ProjectBahaworld.Process04ListTitle0502: After the UI library was established, the time required for tasks such as adding new pages or modifying components decreased by 20% .
ProjectBahashopping.Reason: User surveys have shown that the user flow of the old version of the online store does not align with the current mobile environment. Therefore, the e-commerce department has decided to redesign the Bahamut Store pages by introducing a new third-party payment process.
ProjectBahashopping.Problem01: Create a user interface that reduces UX complexity and supports multiple devices, allowing users to navigate freely on mobile phones and tablets.
ProjectBahashopping.Problem02: Simplify the process from 'Start to purchase' to 'Checkout completion.'
ProjectBahashopping.Process03: Optimize the old UI design layput
ProjectBahashopping.Process01ListContent: Filter out unnecessary clutter from the old version's pages to avoid disturbing user interactions with non-essential information.
ProjectBahashopping.Process02ListContent: Simplify the complex checkout steps of the old version.
ProjectBahashopping.Process03ListContent: Redesign components and requirements to maintain a consistent design style.
Ensure that the service functions seamlessly on different devices such as mobile phones, tablets, and personal computers.
Based on user research of the online store, plan the shortest paths for users.
ProjectBahashopping.Process04ListTitle05: After implementing RWD, within one month there was a 30% increase in page views (PV) and a 5% increase in sales.
SideProjectChatGPT.Reason: チャットGPTの仕組みを掘り下げるために、Open AIのドキュメントを勉強し、パラメータを再調整してチャットGPTをポートフォリオウェアで再現します。
SideProjectChatGPT.Point01: 入力フォームは必要です、もし入力内容を書わなくまま送信ボタンを押しれば、エラーメッセージは出てきます。
SideProjectChatGPT.Point02: TypeScriptでエイシンクでAPIのやり取りを処理する
SideProjectChatGPT.Point03: メッセージのパラメータを再調整する
SideProjectFortune.Reason: To maintain my coding skills, I built a small fortune-seeking function using TypeScript and Vue 3.
SideProjectFortune.Point01: There are four kinds of omikuji: '大吉' (daikiji), '吉' (kiji), '末吉' (suekiji), and '大凶' (daikyou).
SideProjectFortune.Point02: The click event won't be activated while the animation is in progress.
